Class Plan

java.lang.Object
com.pld.agile.model.graph.Plan
public class Plan extends Object
The Plan class is responsible for reading and processing a city plan in XML format, which consists of intersections and sections between them. It also calculates the cost matrix for the graph and computes the shortest paths between intersections using Dijkstra's algorithm.

      public void resetMap()
      Resets the map, clearing all intersections and sections previously loaded.

      public void softResetMap()

      Returns:

      Parameters:

    • reIndexIntersections

      private void reIndexIntersections()
      Re-indexes all intersections in the plan based on their IDs.

    • reverseIndexation

      private void reverseIndexation()
      gets all intersection's ids using the predefined indexes in reIndexIntersections() .

    • initializeCostsMatrix

      private void initializeCostsMatrix()
      Initializes the cost matrix for the graph with 0 or infinity values. This method sets the distance from a node to itself as 0 and sets all other distances to infinity.

    • fillCostsMAtrix

      private void fillCostsMAtrix()
      Fills the cost matrix based on the sections read from the XML file.

    • makeCostsMatrix

      private void makeCostsMatrix()
      makes the cost matrix using the values extarcted from the file

    • preprocessData

      public void preprocessData()
      Processes the data by creating indexing the ids of the intersections of the map and creating the cost matrix.

    • initializeDistances

      private double[] initializeDistances(int numNodes, int origin)
      Initializes an array of distances for Dijkstra's algorithm. All distances are initially set to Double.MAX_VALUE (infinity), except for the origin node, which is set to 0.
      Parameters:
      numNodes - the total number of nodes in the graph
      origin - the index of the origin node
      Returns:
      a double[] array where the distance to the origin node is 0 and all other distances are infinity

    • initializePreviousNodes

      private int[] initializePreviousNodes(int numNodes)
      Initializes the previous nodes array for Dijkstra's algorithm. Each node is initially set to -1, meaning no predecessor has been assigned yet.
      Parameters:
      numNodes - the total number of nodes in the graph
      Returns:
      an int[] array where all values are set to -1

    • updateNeighborDistances

      private void updateNeighborDistances(int currentNode, int numNodes, double[] distances, boolean[] visited, int[] previousNodes, PriorityQueue<Integer> priorityQueue, ArrayList<ArrayList<Double>> costsMatrix)
      Updates the distances of neighboring nodes for the current node during Dijkstra's algorithm. This method checks unvisited neighbors and updates their distance and predecessor if a shorter path is found through the current node. It then adds the neighbor to the priority queue for further exploration.
      Parameters:
      currentNode - the index of the current node being processed
      numNodes - the total number of nodes in the graph
      distances - the array of current shortest distances from the origin
      visited - the array indicating whether a node has been visited
      previousNodes - the array storing the previous node for each node in the shortest path
      priorityQueue - the priority queue for selecting the next node to process
      costsMatrix - the adjacency matrix representing the cost between nodes

    • reconstructPath

      private List<Integer> reconstructPath(int destination, int origin, int[] previousNodes)
      Reconstructs the shortest path from the origin to the destination using the previous nodes array generated by Dijkstra's algorithm. The path is traced backwards from the destination to the origin.
      Parameters:
      destination - the index of the destination node
      origin - the index of the origin node
      previousNodes - the array storing the previous node for each node in the shortest path
      Returns:
      a List<Integer> representing the shortest path from the origin to the destination. If no path exists, an empty list is returned.

    • dijkstraAlgorithm

      private Map<String,Object> dijkstraAlgorithm(int origin, int destination)
      Uses Dijkstra's algorithm to compute the shortest path between two nodes (origin and destination) in the graph, based on the cost matrix.
      Parameters:
      origin - the index of the starting node
      destination - the index of the destination node
      Returns:
      a map containing the total distance and the array of previous nodes

    • findShortestPath

      public List<Integer> findShortestPath(int origin, int destination)
      Finds the shortest path between two nodes (origin and destination) and returns it as a list of node indices.
      Parameters:
      origin - the index of the starting node
      destination - the index of the destination node
      Returns:
      a list of node indices representing the shortest path

    • findShortestDistance

      public double findShortestDistance(int origin, int destination)
      Finds the shortest distance between two nodes (origin and destination) and returns a double
      Parameters:
      origin - the index of the starting node
      destination - the index of the destination node
      Returns:
      the cost of the shortest path

    • constructTour

      private void constructTour(List<Integer> path)
      Constructs a tour by finding the shortest paths between consecutive nodes and ensuring that no duplicates exist in the tour.
      Parameters:
      path - the list of nodes to visit

    • makeIntersectionsTour

      private List<Intersection> makeIntersectionsTour()
      Converts the tour of node indices to a tour of intersection IDs.
      Returns:
      the list of intersection IDs in the order of the tour

    • computeTour

      public List<Intersection> computeTour(List<Integer> path)
      Computes the complete tour of intersections based on a given path and returns the result as a list of intersection IDs.
      Parameters:
      path - the list of nodes to visit
      Returns:
      the list of intersection IDs in the order of the tour

    • formatInput

      public List<Integer> formatInput(List<String> idIntersections)
      Formats the input list of intersection IDs into a list of node indices.
      Parameters:
      idIntersections - the list of intersection IDs
      Returns:
      the formatted list of node indices

    • readXmlbyFile

      public void readXmlbyFile(org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file) throws Exception
      Reads an XML file from a MultipartFile and parses its content into the list of intersections and sections.
      Parameters:
      file - the uploaded XML file
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the reading or parsing process
